abstract.text: Creates a single pixel buffer for a given size and pixel format.

inlineContent.text: The allocator to use for creating the buffer pool. Pass
for the
parameter to use the default allocator. See
for additional values you can use.
The width of the pixel buffer, in pixels.
The height of the pixel buffer, in pixels.
The pixel format identified by its four-character code.
An optional dictionary that contains the attributes for the pixel buffer. See
for possible values.
On output, the newly created pixel buffer.
A Core Video result code. See
for possible values.
Some of the parameters specified in this function override equivalent pixel buffer attributes. For example, if you set values for the
and

and

Use

If you need to create and release multiple pixel buffers, use
to create a pixel buffer pool that efficiently reuses pixel buffer memory.

abstract.text: Process digital video, including manipulation of individual frames, using a pipeline-based API and support for both Metal and OpenGL.
A reference to a Core Video pixel buffer object.
Creates a single pixel buffer for a given size and pixel format.
Creates a pixel buffer for a given size and pixel format containing data specified by a memory location.
Creates a single pixel buffer for the IO surface that you specify.
Creates a single pixel buffer in planar format for a given size and pixel format containing data specified by a memory location.
A Core Video error type return value.
A key to the height of the pixel buffer.
A key to the width of the pixel buffer.
The attributes associated with a pixel buffer.
Describes the result codes generated by Core Video operations.
CFAllocator provides the following predefined allocators. In general, you should use `kCFAllocatorDefault` unless one of the special circumstances exist below.
A reference to a CFAllocator object.
A reference to an immutable dictionary object.
A pointer for accessing and manipulating data of a specific type.
